answers.answer: That is the sort of problem that in the US we would evaluate either today or Monday morning. Where do you have to wait for 6 weeks?Statistically the most common causes by far would be diabetic retinopathy or maculopathy.  100% of type I diabetics as long as you have some degree of diabetes.The sooner you are seen by an Eye MD retina ophthalmologist the betterJCH MD

question: hi, im wondering if anyone can help me. Im diabetic (26 yrs of type 1) and have started losing vision in my right eye over the last few weeks. i have small bleeds in my retina, but nothing really to suggest the amount of blurred vision i now have. My doctor or optician have no answers and im waiting to be seen in hospital in 6 weeks time. My concern is ill be totally blind in that eye by then. Does anyone have any ideas? Im scared i have a brain tumour or something thats causing this.Thanks
title: blurred vision in 1 eye
